New Records: Finn Allen bludgeoned five fours and three sixes in his 16-ball knock which yielded 42 runs.
Key Match Events: Finn Allen laid waste to Australia's first-choice bowling attack, including Josh Hazlewood, Pat Cummins, and Mitchell Starc.
New Zealand put on 56 for the first wicket in just 25 deliveries.
Pre-Game Insights: This is a massive occasion. This is game one of a T20 World Cup against the current champions on their home patch.
This is one of the best bowling attacks I've ever seen in white ball cricket on their home patch.
Post-Match Reflections: Ian Smith on commentary said, 'This is one of the best bowling attacks I've ever seen in white ball cricket on their home patch, but they weren't allowed to. Quite incredible how New Zealand just went bang right from the outset, and it worked.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Finn Allen's aggressive strokeplay provided a stark contrast to New Zealand's batting efforts in last year's World Cup final against Australia, where it ambled to a score of 57 inside the first 10 overs.
